meta.name: awa-pgtop
meta.title: Microsoft Research Blog - Microsoft Research

meta.name: description
meta.content: The Microsoft Research blog provides in-depth views and perspectives from our researchers, scientists and engineers, plus announcements about noteworthy events, scholarships, and fellowships designed for academic and scientific communities.

The Microsoft Research blog provides in-depth views and perspectives from our researchers, scientists and engineers, plus announcements about noteworthy events, scholarships, and fellowships designed for academic and scientific communities.

a.data-bi-name: Archai can design your neural network with state-of-the-art neural architecture search (NAS)
a.aria-label: Archai can design your neural network with state-of-the-art neural architecture search (NAS)

img.alt: illustration of the neural architecture search platform Archai automatically identifying neural network architectures for a given dataset.

a.data-bi-name: Archai can design your neural network with state-of-the-art neural architecture search (NAS)
a.span: Archai can design your neural network with state-of-the-art neural architecture search (NAS)

div.div: October 1, 2020 by Shital Shah and Debadeepta Dey

The goal of neural architecture search (NAS) is to have computers automatically search for the best-performing neural networks. Recent advances in NAS methods have made it possible to build problem-specific networks that are faster, more compact, and less power hungry than their handcrafted counterparts. Unfortunately,…

a.data-bi-name: CodeXGLUE: A benchmark dataset and open challenge for code intelligence
a.aria-label: CodeXGLUE: A benchmark dataset and open challenge for code intelligence

a.data-bi-name: CodeXGLUE: A benchmark dataset and open challenge for code intelligence

h3.a: CodeXGLUE: A benchmark dataset and open challenge for code intelligence

div.div: According to Evans Data Corporation, there are 23.9 million professional developers in 2019, and the population is expected to reach 28.7 million in 2024. With the growing population of developers, code intelligence, which aims to leverage AI to help software developers improve the productivity of…
September 29, 2020

a.data-bi-name: Measuring dataset similarity using optimal transport
a.aria-label: Measuring dataset similarity using optimal transport

a.data-bi-name: Measuring dataset similarity using optimal transport

h3.a: Measuring dataset similarity using optimal transport

div.div: Is FashionMNIST, a dataset of images of clothing items labeled by category, more similar to MNIST or to USPS, both of which are classification datasets of handwritten digits? This is a pretty hard question to answer, but the solution could have an impact on various…
September 24, 2020 by David Alvarez-Melis and Nicolo Fusi

a.data-bi-name: Project InnerEye open-source deep learning toolkit: Democratizing medical imaging AI
a.aria-label: Project InnerEye open-source deep learning toolkit: Democratizing medical imaging AI

a.data-bi-name: Project InnerEye open-source deep learning toolkit: Democratizing medical imaging AI

h3.a: Project InnerEye open-source deep learning toolkit: Democratizing medical imaging AI

div.div: For over a decade, the Project InnerEye team at Microsoft Research Cambridge has been developing state-of-the-art machine learning methods for the automatic, quantitative analysis of three-dimensional medical images. An important application is to assist clinicians for image preparation and planning tasks for radiotherapy cancer treatment.…
September 22, 2020 by Javier Alvarez-Valle and Gregory J. Moore, MD, PhD

a.data-bi-name: In search for future of cloud storage, researchers look to holographic storage solutions
a.aria-label: In search for future of cloud storage, researchers look to holographic storage solutions

a.data-bi-name: In search for future of cloud storage, researchers look to holographic storage solutions

h3.a: In search for future of cloud storage, researchers look to holographic storage solutions

div.div: Data storage has always been a key tenet of compute, and with the massive growth in cloud compute, the demand for cloud data storage has opened an avenue for both revisiting prior technologies and developing new ones. It is projected that around 125 zettabytes of…
September 22, 2020 by Benn Thomsen, Dushyanth Narayanan, and Ant Rowstron

a.data-bi-name: Dialogue as Dataflow: A new approach to conversational AI
a.aria-label: Dialogue as Dataflow: A new approach to conversational AI

img.alt: a screenshot of a cell phone

a.data-bi-name: Dialogue as Dataflow: A new approach to conversational AI

h3.a: Dialogue as Dataflow: A new approach to conversational AI

div.div: By the Semantic Machines research team “Easier said than done.” These four words reflect the promise of conversational AI. It takes just seconds to ask When are Megan and I both free? but much longer to find out manually from a calendar. Indeed, almost everything…
September 21, 2020

a.data-bi-name: DeepSpeed: Extreme-scale model training for everyone
a.aria-label: DeepSpeed: Extreme-scale model training for everyone

a.data-bi-name: DeepSpeed: Extreme-scale model training for everyone

h3.a: DeepSpeed: Extreme-scale model training for everyone

div.div: In February, we announced DeepSpeed, an open-source deep learning training optimization library, and ZeRO (Zero Redundancy Optimizer), a novel memory optimization technology in the library, which vastly advances large model training by improving scale, speed, cost, and usability. DeepSpeed has enabled researchers to create Turing…
September 10, 2020 by DeepSpeed Team, Rangan Majumder, and Junhua Wang

div.div: The need to express oneself is innate for every person in the world, and its roots run through art, technology, communication, and the acts of learning and building things from the ground up. It’s no coincidence, then, that a new platform being released by Microsoft…
September 3, 2020

h3.a: Platform for Situated Intelligence: An open-source framework for multimodal, integrative AI

div.div: Over the years at Microsoft Research, we’ve studied how to build AI systems that perceive, understand, and act in a human-filled world in real time. Our motivation has been to create computing systems that can support interactive experiences akin to what we expect when we…
September 2, 2020 by Dan Bohus and Sean Andrist

August 31, 2020 by Hoifung Poon and Jianfeng Gao

div.div: Since its launch in November 2019, Microsoft HoloLens 2 has helped enterprises in manufacturing, construction, healthcare, and retail onboard employees more quickly, complete tasks faster, and greatly reduce errors and waste. It sets the high-water mark for intelligent edge devices by leveraging a multitude of…
August 28, 2020 by Marc Pollefeys

div.div: To unearth a diamond in the block-based open world of Minecraft requires the acquisition of materials and the construction of tools before any diamond mining can even begin. Players need to gather wood, which they’ll use to make a wood pickaxe for mining stone underground.…
August 20, 2020 by Noboru Sean Kuno
